rev.desc.rev.desc: The dropdown lists of "View" are not translated when opening "Search Changes"page
robust for upgrade, update panel get.inbox, set error exit to no.inbox.found
Modify Columns does not work in inbox view after upgrade

if (not (null($L.inbox.record))) then if (use.normalized in $L.inbox.record=true) then if (normalized.query in $L.inbox.record)#"jscall" then ($L.void=evaluate(parse("$L.tempQuery=str("+normalized.query in $L.inbox.record+")", 11));$L.raw.query=$L.tempQuery) else ($L.raw.query=normalized.query in $L.inbox.record) else if (query in $L.inbox.record)#"jscall" then ($L.void=evaluate(parse("$L.tempQuery=str("+query in $L.inbox.record+")", 11));$L.raw.query=$L.tempQuery) else ($L.raw.query=query in $L.inbox.record)
refresh fail when the sql is changed from the view initial sql
Modified get.records panel to parse "sortby" and "groupby" parameters to generate.sql.query, no need add sort and group fields in $L.field.list
Roll back the modifications of logical name solution, the logic is handled in RTE instead

Replace select panel by fselect function to get search colunms before doing select, this is for logical name solution purpose. RTE will decide if needs do cross-table query based on the search columns
Append Query doesn't Work for To Do Queue of any Modules in non-PD ENV.
[In-tool Reporting]Add assignment.groups to check the view
[In-tool-reporting] Don't display the disabled report in todo queue.
add new panel chck.possible.edit.view to check edit view action even if in the displayoption set to true, to prevent to edit view for no rights or non-existing view.
Exit automatically when select view which name contains symbol $. Reviewer: Qi, qing-song
"Append query" functionality no longer works in new security model in Change Management
Newly-created View is not displayed unless Queue is changed, Refresh button pressed, or client restarted
QCCR1E65841--If a profile includes an Append Query, the query is applied to searches but not to Views

if (not null($L.env) and not null($L.filename) and $L.filename="probsummary") then ($L.append.query=append.query in $L.env;if (not null($L.append.query)) then ($L.query="("+$L.query+") "+$L.append.query))

if (not null($L.env) and not null($L.filename)) then ($L.append.query.orig=append.query in $L.env;if (not null($L.append.query.orig)) then ($L.append.query=str($L.append.query.orig);$L.temp=strtrml($L.append.query);$L.myidx=index(" ", $L.append.query);if ($L.myidx>0) then ($L.myidx-=1;$L.start=toupper(substr($L.append.query, 1, $L.myidx));if (not null($L.start) and ($L.start="AND" or $L.start="OR")) then ($L.query="("+$L.query+")"+$L.append.query) else $L.query+=(" and ("+$L.append.query+")")) else $L.query+=(" and ("+$L.append.query+")")))
QCCR1E63191-Query appended to a profile is applied in searches but not in Views
Add process after panel get.records of RAD scm.advanced as below:

if (not null($L.env) and not null($L.filename) and $L.filename="probsummary") then ($L.append.query=append.query in $L.env;if (not null($L.append.query)) then ($L.query="("+$L.query+") "+$L.append.query))
bring $G.assigment.plus back druing login for custormer upgrade
remove GL $G.assignment.plus during log in, create it dynamically
Removed the following from line 8 in 'start' panel as the global $G.operator.plus is not used:
not build $G.scm.files2 variable during login. build it when needed.
when the group by field is same as the order by field. set $L.dd.sort as exmpty, to avoid double order by failure.
Can't switch to other record in QBE list. This was caused by the last fix. The variable was entered as $L.multi instead of $L.mult
reverted changes done to fix QC 8379, that fix causes record list to disappear.
Panel thread.engine changed 2nd entry in Value list back to $L.multi
After a change is moved to a new phase, the queu is ndisplaying wrong change under grouping

Modified the 'build.inbox.list' and 'rebuild.lists' panels so that the 'Max Recs' parameter is set to 300. This way, users are allowed to select from as many as 300 views from the Manage Queue screens.
Added support for the new select panel parameters related to sorting and grouping.
Made it impossible for $L.related.query to be NULL on get.records.
Aded a check for $G.ess to not thread if in ESS mode. This prevents the jumping from back button to the menu from the Individual Subscription view.
When using a passed query from a display option, have to NULL out the original and raw queries.
Added a parameter to pass in an inbox record (DE2155)
backed out changes made below because they caused other issues.
Hua: fixed post.display so that $L.query is not null
Changes made for related objects cause normalized query to never be used.
there was a debug statement in one of the IF statements "or true" which was causing problems.

inserted a panel before the check.query panel (now called check.query.1). The inserted panel is check.query and it basically resets all the variables dealing with sorting and grouping. This way they cleaned even when the inbox being displayed is using a query and is not an actual defined View.
Modified to create a fieldlist for a generic form so that the autoformat rules can be applied if no fields are specified in the view.
Modified last fix to ignore generic formats.
Will no longer keep last field list if the new field list is blank. Instead it uses the default scm qbe record from the object.
Fixed To Do processing when using threading.
Modified get.inbox.1 so that generic objects using views with no fields would not lose the qbe format.
Override default sort to keep grouping information.
When looking at a query, you wont have the "Customize Current View" option anymore.
This way if $L.name already has a value it will not be replaced with the default query set in the Object record.
reset inbox when using a query.
added the $L.switch.inbox variable to the try.initial.inbox panel...set this to the filename. Also added it to the list of variables on the display.queue.1 panel.
Fixed bug where when group was removed it was still put into the sorting algorhythim.
Pass the view along to the doc engine
Views and inboxes are now the same.
Added sort fields in setsort for grouping.
Fixed so a null value wont be passed to the format generation routine.
Modified to show all available inboxes in the drop down list rather than favorites.
Modified panel setup.scm.query to change the query from:
Reworked how $L.title is setup to make it easier to localize the whole title.
Modified panels get.object and get.work.object. Set Background flags to false in order to prompt for the profile to choose.
Modified panel setup.scm.query to change the query from:
Null out $L.dd.sort when $L.sort was nulled out (switching inboxes).
Removed the object variable from the paramters passed
Modified to remove all translation for probsummary to problem and incidents to call.

Panel set.query added +" and (null(groups) or groups isin "+str(denull($lo.groups))+")" to the $L.sub.query line
Panel set.name added +" and (null(groups) or groups isin "+str(denull($lo.groups))+")" to the $L.sub.query line
$L.current.filename=$L.filename (this will keep a copy of the current filename for comparison on the next panel)
the normal exit for this panel is 'get.object'
If the current filename and the original filename are the same then there is no reason to get the object and check for authorization again...the application will simply exit.
$L.filename=$L.original.filename (this will set the filename back to the original one the user originally came into...probsummary etc)
This way the user will get taken back to whatever inbox they were in last...not the original one they started in.
The call.mass.inactivate panel was missing $L.file from the query parameter field. (is...nothing was being passed so the applicaiton failed).
added an action of 'inactivate' to the display.decide panel. This calls the apm.mass.inactivate application
On the setup.get.inbox panel added the line
On the setup.new.inbox panel added the line

I created a new variable, $L.inbox.filename, to which I either assign the filename or NULL...depending on whether or not the Current Inbox drop-down was being used OR the switch inbox button. When switching to an inbox of a different file then we want the filename to be NULL so that the query is able to pull back the correct inbox.
Display proper inbox name for Approval/Review/Owner/Assignment buttons on queues.

updated the new.inbox panel. The inbox type (filename) was not being passed to the apm.get.inbox.by.name application. Changed it so that it passed $L.filename.set which contains the filename for the inbox.
Fixed problem where a sub inbox list is displayed if no initial inbox is found.
Will now exit if not authorized for a specifiy database.

Modified the 'build.inbox.list' and 'rebuild.lists' panels so that the 'Max Recs' parameter is set to 300. This way, users are allowed to select from as many as 300 views from the Manage Queue screens.

Override default sort to keep grouping information.

This way if $L.name already has a value it will not be replaced with the default query set in the Object record.

Fixed bug where when group was removed it was still put into the sorting algorhythim.

Views and inboxes are now the same.

Fixed so a null value wont be passed to the format generation routine.
Modified to show all available inboxes in the drop down list rather than favorites.

If the current filename and the original filename are the same then there is no reason to get the object and check for authorization again...the application will simply exit.
$L.filename=$L.original.filename (this will set the filename back to the original one the user originally came into...probsummary etc)
This way the user will get taken back to whatever inbox they were in last...not the original one they started in.

When switching to an inbox of a different file then we want the filename to be NULL so that the query is able to pull back the correct inbox.

updated the new.inbox panel. The inbox type (filename) was not being passed to the apm.get.inbox.by.name application. Changed it so that it passed $L.filename.set which contains the filename for the inbox.
